themes: exclusion due to lack of formal training or connections
lack of sustained funding for grassroots organizations
burnout among staff in grassroots arts organizations
key_phrases: arts world can be insular and dominated by those with formal training, institutional access, or industry connections
many talented individuals are excluded because they didn’t attend a certain school or know the 'right' people
events, workshops, or professional development opportunities are expensive
for people from low-income communities, this creates a significant barrier
grassroots arts organizations that are doing vital cultural work often don’t receive sustained funding
burnout among staff and lost opportunities for community impact and advancement
barriers_identified: exclusion based on lack of formal training
exclusion due to lack of institutional access or industry connections
high costs for admission, materials, travel, or education
lack of sustained funding for grassroots organizations
